instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) quarter spin
threads.message: The logic board had water damage around <CHIP>U9420</CHIP> and when connect magsafe have green light then orange ,fans make looping quarter spin, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is steady 12.55V but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is from 3.3V to 0V

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) quarter spin
threads.message: Fix the quarter spin it was the trace on <RESISTOR>R5120</RESISTOR> but now I have black screen and no chime ,cpu getting hot and <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 1.1V

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) quarter spin
threads.message:
Do you have USB activity?
Check with mouse, or boot pendrive (with LED).

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) quarter spin
threads.message: No USb activity ,try with mouse no lights

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) quarter spin
threads.message: Power to GPU present? It could be anything really, inspect better for corrosion everywhere.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) quarter spin
threads.message: What I notice that when I have quarter spin the on SPI chip (<CHIP>U6100</CHIP>) I have fluctuating voltage from 3.3V to 0V on pin 5 and 6 and after i fix traces  no more quarter spin but no voltage on that two pin

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) quarter spin
threads.message: SOLVED reprogram new bios All works now

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) quarter spin
threads.message: Did you fix the ME region?
